alert.note: Alert for Phillips County; Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 5:13AM MST until December 14 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...LINGERING WINTER WEATHER IMPACTS OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS... .A strong winter storm system will continue to move slowly east across the northern plains today. As the storm moves away from Colorado, snowfall will be very limited, but strong winds will continue especially across the northeastern plains. The winds will continue to produce blowing and drifting snow. The worst conditions will be from Sterling and Akron eastward, while conditions should gradually improve west of Fort Morgan and Limon. Many roadways are still closed as of early this morning, so people should check the status of the highways before attempting travel. Some rural roads may remain drifted in for some time as continued wind slows progress on clearing them. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blowing snow ongoing. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Julesburg, and Holyoke. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause continued drifting across roads.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Many roads will be closed or impassable until they can be cleared. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
